skill.name: Documentation Consistency Reviewer
skill.summary: Reviews documentation against code implementation to find inconsistencies
skill.author: Community

security_audit.summary: All 36 static findings are false positives. The scanner misidentified markdown code fence syntax (```) as shell backticks, YAML frontmatter as obfuscation, and multilingual text as cryptographic patterns. This is a passive documentation review skill with no runtime execution.

content.value_statement: Documentation often diverges from code over time, causing confusion and bugs. This skill systematically audits documentation against actual implementation to identify outdated or inaccurate descriptions. It helps maintain trustworthy documentation that accurately reflects your codebase.
actual_capabilities: Reviews README and docs/ directory against code implementation
Validates API documentation against OpenAPI/proto/GraphQL schema/TypeScript types
Checks configuration and environment variable documentation accuracy
Generates detailed consistency reports with evidence-based findings
limitations: Does not modify files or update documentation automatically
Cannot verify external dependencies or third-party service documentation
Relies on existing code structure and does not execute code

use_cases.title: Documentation maintenance
use_cases.description: Keep your project documentation accurate and trustworthy through systematic audits

use_cases.title: PR documentation checks
use_cases.description: Verify that documentation changes match code changes in pull requests

use_cases.title: New team member onboarding
use_cases.description: Identify outdated documentation that could mislead new contributors

prompt_templates.title: Basic review
prompt_templates.prompt: Review the documentation in this project for consistency with the code implementation. Check README.md and docs/ directory.

prompt_templates.title: API verification
prompt_templates.prompt: Verify that the API documentation matches the actual API implementation. Check OpenAPI specs, TypeScript types, and code against docs/api.md.

prompt_templates.title: Security audit
prompt_templates.prompt: Audit security-related documentation. Check that security configurations like sandbox, contextIsolation, and authentication match what the code actually implements.

prompt_templates.title: Full project audit
prompt_templates.prompt: Perform a comprehensive documentation consistency review using the doc-consistency-reviewer skill. Check README, API docs, configuration docs, security docs, and all other documentation against code. Output findings to doc-consistency.md.

output_examples.input: Review the documentation in this project for consistency with the code implementation
output: P0 - Security configuration mismatch: docs/security.md claims contextIsolation is enabled but src/main/window.ts:23 has contextIsolation: false
P1 - API field name inconsistency: docs/api.md documents camelCase fields but code returns snake_case at src/routes/users.ts:45
P2 - Missing environment variable: API_TIMEOUT is used in code but not documented in README
P3 - Link outdated: docs/deployment.md references a deprecated CI configuration file

best_practices: Run documentation reviews before major releases to catch outdated content
Prioritize P0 and P1 findings that could mislead users or cause failures
Use the generated report as a checklist for documentation maintenance
anti_patterns: Accepting findings without verifying against actual code behavior
Skipping cross-reference checks between API docs and implementation

faq.question: Does this skill modify my documentation?
faq.answer: No. The skill only reviews and reports inconsistencies. It does not write or modify any files.

faq.question: What file types does it check?
faq.answer: The skill focuses on Markdown documentation. It validates against source code, configs, and schema files.

faq.question: How are severity levels determined?
faq.answer: P0 indicates security or criticalËØØÂØº issues. P1 means core functionality mismatch. P2 is minor issues. P3 is formatting.

faq.question: Can it review non-English documentation?
faq.answer: Yes. The skill can review documentation in any language. Code comparison is language-independent.

faq.question: What counts as source of truth?
faq.answer: The skill prioritizes source code, configuration files, and schema definitions (OpenAPI, proto, GraphQL, TypeScript types).

faq.question: How long does a review take?
faq.answer: Review time depends on documentation size. For large projects, consider splitting by documentation type or module.
